title: Meat Pie
method: Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Step 2: Place potato in a saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Drain, mash, and set aside.

Step 4: Meanwhile, crumble ground beef and pork into a large saucepan. Add onion, garlic, mustard powder, thyme, sage, cloves, salt, and black pepper. Stir in water. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until meat is evenly browned.
Step 5: Remove from the heat and mix in mashed potato.
Step 6: Ease one pie crust into a 9-inch pie plate. Fill with meat mixture, then top with the remaining pie crust.
Step 7: Trim any excess dough, then crimp the edges with the tines of a fork to seal.
Step 8: Prick top crust a few times with a knife to vent steam. Cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil.
Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until crust is browned, about 25 minutes.
